data.title: How to click on Load More button within Google Trends and print all the titles through Selenium and Python
data.meta_description:
this time I would like to click a button in order to load more real-time searches. Here is the link of the website:

https://trends.google.com/trends/trendingsearches/realtime?geo=AR&category=a...
data.text:
for scrolling down you can use this code :

driver.execute_script("window.scrollTo(0, Y)")

where Y : is the vertical position you want to scroll to.(you can provide the value of Y as 100,200,300 as per your requirement).

Once scroll down is done, you can use this code :

load_more_button = WebDriverWait(driver,20).until(EC.element_to_be_clickable((By.XPATH, "//div[@ng-click='ctrl.loadMoreFeedItems()']"))) load_more_button.click()

Find it with find_elements_by_css_selector and click on it. I don't think if you need to wait or scroll.

element = driver.find_elements_by_css_selector("div[ng-click=\"ctrl.loadMoreFeedItems()\"]") element.click()

Read this answer, if you wonder why I have not used xPath.
